newsArray.title: Afghanistan vs West Indies Live Score 1st T20I: Rising Stars Face Two-Time Winners In Final Series Before T20 World Cup
newsArray.description: Afghanistan vs West Indies Live Score 1st T20I: The Afghanistan Cricket team will take on West Indies in the first of three T20Is in what is the last series for both teams before they travel to India and Sri Lanka for the 2026 T20 World Cup. All three matches are set to take place at the iconic Dubai International Stadium in Dubai. Afghanistan will be led by Rashid Khan, who left the SA20 early for this series. They reached the semi-finals of the 2024 T20 World Cup, which marked the first instance of them reaching the knockouts in a global men's senior tournamentThe West Indies are two-time winners but have yet to name their squad for the mega event. A lot of players have the chance to make their case for selection. Shai Hope, Roston Chase, Akeal Hosein and Sherfane Rutherford are absent as they are playing SA20. This is the third time the two teams have played a bilateral series. West Indies won a home series in 2017 by a 3-0 margin. Later, Afghanistan beat them 2-1 in 2019 in a series in India. Toss: The toss will take place at 7:30 PM IST Weather Updates: No rain is expected. A relatively cool day with temperatures ranging between 17 and 21 degree celcius. Pitch report: A sluggish surface is expected Head To Head: The two teams have played each other in 8 T20Is. West Indies have won five times while Afghanistan have three victories. Afghanistan Squad: Sediqullah Atal, Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmanullah Gurbaz(w), Gulbadin Naib, Darwish Rasooli, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Shahidullah Kamal, Mohammad Ishaq, Rashid Khan(c), Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Ziaur Rahman Sharifi, Noor Ahmad, Abdullah AhmadzaiWest Indies Squad: Evin Lewis, Alick Athanaze, Brandon King(c), Shimron Hetmyer, Johnson Charles(w), Keacy Carty, Justin Greaves, Quentin Sampson, Gudakesh Motie, Amir Jangoo, Matthew Forde, Jayden Seales, Shamar Springer, Khary Pierre, Ramon Simmonds, Shamar Joseph
keywords: afg vs wi live cricket score
west indies vs afghanistan live cricket
creator: times now digital

newsArray.title: T20 WC: BCB denies ICC deadline, reiterates demand for alternative venue
newsArray.description: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has denied reports that the ICC set a January 21 deadline for a T20 World Cup decision, saying no timeline was given. Bangladesh has again asked for an alternative venue, citing security and pride. Talks continue amid conflicting claims, with the ICC reluctant to change schedules and Bangladesh pushing for a venue or group swap.
